headline: Unilever Proves Consumer Staples Can Still Grow Volume
summary: Unilever continues to outperform peers in volume growth, supported by emerging markets. Click here to read why I reaffirm my Buy rating on UL stock.

headline: P&G (PG) Net Margin Rises, Reinforcing Narrative of Consistency Despite Slower Growth Outlook
summary: Procter & Gamble (PG) posted a net profit margin of 18.6%, up from 17.4% last year, while annual earnings growth accelerated to 7.5%, outpacing the company’s five-year average expansion of 2.2% per year. With its Price-To-Earnings ratio at 22.8x, below the peer average, and shares currently trading at $152.49, there is a constructive valuation setup. Investors may see the widening margins and steady progress as a sign that Procter & Gamble continues to deliver high-quality, consistent results...

headline: PG Q3 Deep Dive: Innovation and Restructuring Shape Outlook Amid Flat Market Reaction
summary: Consumer products behemoth Proctor & Gamble (NYSE:PG) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 3% year on year to $22.39 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.99 per share was 4.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
